chapter.title: Reporting Data
chapter.para: GMAT provides several ways to report mission data (such as altitude or delta-V values) to plain text files. GMAT can report data at each integration time step in the mission or at specific mission events, such as periapsis passage. The report functionality is controlled via the ReportFile resource and the Report and Toggle commands.

section.title: Reporting Data During a Propagation Span
section.para: You can report data at each integration step in the mission sequence by creating a ReportFile resource and adding data to it. Starting from the default mission:

listitem.para: On the Resources tree, right-click the Output folder, point to Add, and click ReportFile.
In the Parameter List area, click Edit.
In the Selected Value(s) list, click DefaultSC.EarthMJ2000.X and click <- to remove it from the list.
In the Object Properties list, click Altitude and click -> to add it to the Selected Value(s) list.
Add DefaultSC.A1ModJulian to the Selected Value(s) list if it doesn’t already exist.
Click OK, then in the ReportFile - ReportFile1 dialog box, click OK again.
Click Run. To view the generated report, on the Output tree, double-click ReportFile1.

section.para: The script for the report data configured above is shown below.
section.programlisting: Create ReportFile ReportFile1; GMAT ReportFile1.Add = {DefaultSC.A1ModJulian, DefaultSC.Earth.Altitude};

section.title: Reporting Data at a Specific Mission Event
section.para: You can report data to a ReportFile at a desired location in the mission sequence using the Report command. In this How To, you’ll learn how to report spacecraft altitude at orbit apogee. Starting from the default mission:

step.para: In the Resources tree, right-click on the Output folder, point to Add, and click ReportFile.
In the Output folder, double-click on ReportFile1 to open it.
In the Parameter List area, click the Edit button.
In the Selected Values list, click on DefaultSC.EarthMJ2000Eq.X and click the left arrow <- to remove it from the list.
Remove DefaultSC.A1ModJulian from the Selected Value(s) list using the step above.
Click OK to close the ParameterSelectDialog box and then click OK again to close the ReportFile1 dialog box.

section.para: Now you will configure the Propagate1 command to propagate to periapsis then issue a command to report to ReportFile1.

step.para: Click on the Mission tab to bring the mission tree to the foreground.
In the Mission tree, double-click on Propagate1 to open it.
In the Stopping Conditions list, click on the ellipses ... to the left of DefaultSC.ElapsedSecs.
In the Object Properties list, click on Apoapsis then click on the right arrow -> to add it to the Selected Value(s) list.
Click OK to close the ParameterSelectDialog box and then click OK again to close the Propagate1 dialog box.
Right-click on Propagate1, point to Insert After, and then select Report.
Double-click Report1 and click on the View button.
Click on the remove all button <= to remove all items from the Selected Value(s) list.
Click on TA in the Object Properties list then click the right arrow -> to add it to the Selected Value(s) list.
Add Altitude to the Selected Value(s) list using the same step as above.
Click OK to close the ParameterSelectDialog box and then click OK again to close the Report1 dialog box.
In the Toolbar, click Run.
Click the Output tab.
In the Reports folder, click ReportFile1 to you will see the requested data.
